meanings.definition: A disease of the muscles that causes weakness
meanings.sent1: My grandfather struggles with myopathy, making it hard for him to lift heavy objects.
meanings.sent2: Doctors diagnosed her with myopathy after she experienced muscle weakness and fatigue.
meanings.sent3: The weightlifting competition was hilarious as all participants suddenly developed myopathy and couldn't lift a thing!
meanings.sent4: The myopathy of society was evident as people grew weaker in their ability to stand up for what they believed in.
meanings.sent5: The myopathy in her legs felt like invisible weights dragging her down with each step.

meanings.definition: A disorder of the muscles characterized by muscle weakness
meanings.sent1: The athlete's myopathy prevented him from running as fast as he used to.
meanings.sent2: Hereditary myopathy can be passed down through generations, affecting muscle strength.
meanings.sent3: The dance-off turned comical when both competitors suddenly developed myopathy and couldn't keep up with the beat.
meanings.sent4: The myopathy of the team weakened their chances of winning the championship.
meanings.sent5: The myopathy in his arms felt like invisible hands pulling him back from reaching his full potential.
